title: 111_hr5001
content: The Act may be cited as the "Benefit Adjustment of Social Security Income Compensation Act of 2010" or the "BASIC Act." It ensures the continuation of benefits through the month of the beneficiary's death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust old-age and wife's insurance benefits, including changes to the month of eligibility and redesignating subparagraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust husband's and child's insurance benefits, including changes to eligibility months and redesignating subparagraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust widow's and widower's insurance benefits, including changes to eligibility months and redesignating subparagraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust widow's and widower's insurance benefits, including changes to eligibility months and redesignating subparagraphs. Section 202 of the Act is amended to specify the ending month for benefits in case of remarriage, death, or entitlement. Additionally, adjustments are made to mother's and father's insurance benefits, specifying the ending month for benefits in case of death or remarriage. Parent's insurance benefits are also amended to adjust the ending month for benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust various insurance benefits, including widow's, widower's, mother's, father's, and parent's benefits. Changes include specifying the ending month for benefits in case of remarriage, death, or entitlement. Amendments are made to disability insurance benefits and benefits at age 72 for certain uninsured individuals. SEC. 3. COMPUTATION AND PAYMENT OF LAST MONTHLY PAYMENT. Amends Section 202 of the Social Security Act to address the termination of the last monthly insurance benefit upon death. The amount of an individual's monthly insurance benefit under this section paid for the month of their death is calculated based on a fraction of days in that month. This calculation applies after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. Section 223 of the Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding Disability Insurance Benefits. "Last Payment of Benefit Terminated by Death" The amount of an individual's monthly benefit under this section paid for the month of their death is calculated based on a fraction of days in that month. This calculation applies after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. Benefits at Age 72 for Certain Uninsured Individuals are amended under Section 228 of the Act. The last payment of benefits is adjusted upon the death of the individual, calculated based on the days in the month before the death. This adjustment is made after all other benefit adjustments have been applied. Modification of computation of lump-sum death payments: Section 202(I) of the Act is amended to change the calculation to 47 percent of the individual's primary insurance amount or $255, whichever is greater. Disregard of benefit for month of death under family maximum provisions is also addressed. SEC. 5. DISREGARD OF BENEFIT FOR MONTH OF DEATH UNDER FAMILY MAXIMUM PROVISIONS. Amends Section 203(a) of the Social Security Act to disregard the benefit payable for the month of the insured individual's death. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments apply to deaths occurring more than 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
